HMenu

HMenu is a control unit that displays a pull-down or pop-up list of menu items.  A common use of menus is to provide convenient access to various operations such as saving or opening a file, quitting a program, or manipulating data.  A menu can contain simple menu items or other menus (submenus).  A submenu is a menu item that, when selected, reveals still another menu.

Summary
HMenu
HMenu is a control unit that displays a pull-down or pop-up list of menu items.
Instance variables

Removes the item at index, or the specified item, or the item that controls the specified submenu.

Puts the HMenu in radio mode if flag is true and takes it out of radio mode if flag is false.
indexOfItem
Returns the index of the given menu item in this menu.
mouseUpOnMenuItem
This gets called whenever the mouseUp event occurs in a menu item added to this menu.

Instance variables

type’[HMenu]’
valueNumeric value currently set to this object.
labelThe string that is shown as the label of this object.
radioModeReturns whether the HMenu is currently in radio mode.  The default radio mode is false for ordinary HMenus, but true for HPopupMenus.

Extends

HControl

See also

HControl

constructor

constructor: function(_rect,
_parentClass,
_options)

Parameters

_rectAn HRect object that sets the position and dimensions of this control.
_parentClassThe parent view that this control is to be inserted in.
_options(optional) All other parameters.  See HComponentDefaults.

addItem

addItem: function(_item,
_index)
Adds an item to the menu list at indexor, if no index is mentioned, to the end of the list.  If a submenu is specified rather than an item, addItem() constructs a controlling HMenuItem for the submenu and adds the item to the menu.

Parameters

_itemA [HMenuItem] object.
_indexThe index of the item, its ordinal position in the menu.  Indices begin at 0.

removeItem

removeItem: function(_obj)

Removes the item at index, or the specified item, or the item that controls the specified submenu.  Removing the item doesn’t free it.

Parameters

_objThe index of the item, A [HMenuItem] or a [HMenu] object.

Returns

If passed an index, this function returns a pointer to the item so you can free it.  It returns a NULL pointer if the item couldn’t be removed.  If passed an item, it returns true if the item was in the list and could be removed, and false if not.  If passed a submenu, it returns true if the submenu is controlled by an item in the menu and that item could be removed, and false otherwise.

setRadioMode

setRadioMode: function(_mode,
_valueObj)

Puts the HMenu in radio mode if flag is true and takes it out of radio mode if flag is false.  In radio mode, only one item in the menu can be marked at a time.  If the user selects an item, a check mark is placed in front of it automatically (you don’t need to call HMenuItem’s setMarked() function; it’s called for you).  If another item was marked at the time, its mark is removed.  Selecting a currently marked item retains the mark.

Parameters

_valueA numeric value to be set to the object.

See also

HControl.setValue

indexOfItem

indexOfItem: function(_item)

Returns the index of the given menu item in this menu.

Parameters

_itemThe HMenuItem object that is being looked up.

Returns

The index of the location of _item.  -1 is returned if the _item is not found in the menu.

mouseUpOnMenuItem

This gets called whenever the mouseUp event occurs in a menu item added to this menu.

A Rect object represents a rectangle.
Define default setting here.
setValue: function(_value)
Assigns the object a new value.
A HMenuItem object displays one item within a menu and contains the state associated with that item.
